title: Women of Music Doc 'Louder: The Soundtrack of Change' Full Trailer
description: "A lot of women before us paved the way to be as loud and proud as possible." HBO has revealed an official trailer for a documentary film called Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, yet another music history doc bout how music can change the world. Ready for streaming on Max next week. A celebration of music and a rallying cry across generations, genres, anchored by female icons whose songs & activism inspired the fight for equality, empowering all. Multi-platinum recording artist, actress, and entrepreneur Selena Gomez and bestselling author / political activist Stacey Abrams formed a unique bond during the 2020 elections, and, on the eve of another election, this film marks a new collaboration for the iconic duo. Gomez & Abrams passionately credit the legendary musicians Linda Ronstadt and Tracy Chapman for blazing the trails that provided them their motivation for their work. The film also features Chaka Khan, Melissa Etheridge, Linda Ronstadt, H.E.R., Mickey Guyton, Rhiannon Giddens, Kathleen Hanna, Martha Gonzalez, Puja Patel, Suzy Exposito, Clover Hope, and J Wortham. This looks like an inspiring, hopeful film about ...
author: Alex Billington

HBO has revealed an official trailer for a documentary film called Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, yet another music history doc bout how music can change the world. text: by October 11, 2024Source: YouTube "A lot of women before us paved the way to be as loud and proud as possible." HBO has revealed an official trailer for a documentary film called Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, yet another music history doc bout how music can change the world. Ready for streaming on Max next week. A celebration of music and a rallying cry across generations, genres, anchored by female icons whose songs & activism inspired the fight for equality, empowering all. Multi-platinum recording artist, actress, and entrepreneur Selena Gomez and bestselling author / political activist Stacey Abrams formed a unique bond during the 2020 elections, and, on the eve of another election, this film marks a new collaboration for the iconic duo. Gomez & Abrams passionately credit the legendary musicians Linda Ronstadt and Tracy Chapman for blazing the trails that provided them their motivation for their work. The film also features Chaka Khan, Melissa Etheridge, Linda Ronstadt, H.E.R., Mickey Guyton, Rhiannon Giddens, Kathleen Hanna, Martha Gonzalez, Puja Patel, Suzy Exposito, Clover Hope, and J Wortham. This looks like an inspiring, hopeful film about the power of music. Here's the official trailer for Kristi Jacobson's doc Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, via YouTube: The documentary champions the brave, bold, and unapologetic actions, both sung and spoken, of some of the most iconic female musicians of all time. The film is an emotional & inspiring journey filled with stunning archival footage, revealing interviews, and personal accounts from a powerful group of fearless female artists. Exploring musicians' stories from present-day Rhiannon Giddens summoning deep-rooted emotions on a banjo, to H.E.R. processing her grief through her powerful 2020 ballad "I Can't Breathe," to Melissa Etheridge bravely coming out on TV at the peak of early 1990s homophobia, to Mickey Guytonâ€™s present-day struggles as a Black woman in country music. Guided by esteemed journalists, including J Wortham, Puja Patel, and Clover Hope, we are also reminded of the groundbreaking women of 90s hip-hop, highlighting artists like Queen Latifah and Salt-N-Pepa, as well as an interview with Kathleen Hanna whose "Rebel Girl" reflected the rage and anger of the Riot GRRRL movement. ðŸŽ¶ A MakeMake Production. Louder: The Soundtrack of Change is directed by award-winning filmmaker Kristi Jacobson, director of the films Toots, A Place at the Table, Solitary, No Accident, the "Dogs" series, "Through Our Eyes" and other TV series most recently. Produced By Selena Gomez, Stacey Abrams, Aleen Keshishian, Kent Kubena, Terry Leonard, Zack Morgenroth, & Angus Wall. HBO will debut the doc film Louder: The Soundtrack of Change streaming on Max starting October 17th, 2024 coming soon this fall. Who wants to watch this music doc? html:
by
October 11, 2024
Source: YouTube

"A lot of women before us paved the way to be as loud and proud as possible." HBO has revealed an official trailer for a documentary film called Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, yet another music history doc bout how music can change the world. Ready for streaming on Max next week. A celebration of music and a rallying cry across generations, genres, anchored by female icons whose songs & activism inspired the fight for equality, empowering all. Multi-platinum recording artist, actress, and entrepreneur Selena Gomez and bestselling author / political activist Stacey Abrams formed a unique bond during the 2020 elections, and, on the eve of another election, this film marks a new collaboration for the iconic duo. Gomez & Abrams passionately credit the legendary musicians Linda Ronstadt and Tracy Chapman for blazing the trails that provided them their motivation for their work. The film also features Chaka Khan, Melissa Etheridge, Linda Ronstadt, H.E.R., Mickey Guyton, Rhiannon Giddens, Kathleen Hanna, Martha Gonzalez, Puja Patel, Suzy Exposito, Clover Hope, and J Wortham. This looks like an inspiring, hopeful film about the power of music.

Here's the official trailer for Kristi Jacobson's doc Louder: The Soundtrack of Change, via YouTube:

The documentary champions the brave, bold, and unapologetic actions, both sung and spoken, of some of the most iconic female musicians of all time. The film is an emotional & inspiring journey filled with stunning archival footage, revealing interviews, and personal accounts from a powerful group of fearless female artists. Exploring musicians' stories from present-day Rhiannon Giddens summoning deep-rooted emotions on a banjo, to H.E.R. processing her grief through her powerful 2020 ballad "I Can't Breathe," to Melissa Etheridge bravely coming out on TV at the peak of early 1990s homophobia, to Mickey Guytonâ€™s present-day struggles as a Black woman in country music. Guided by esteemed journalists, including J Wortham, Puja Patel, and Clover Hope, we are also reminded of the groundbreaking women of 90s hip-hop, highlighting artists like Queen Latifah and Salt-N-Pepa, as well as an interview with Kathleen Hanna whose "Rebel Girl" reflected the rage and anger of the Riot GRRRL movement. ðŸŽ¶ A MakeMake Production.

Louder: The Soundtrack of Change is directed by award-winning filmmaker Kristi Jacobson, director of the films Toots, A Place at the Table, Solitary, No Accident, the "Dogs" series, "Through Our Eyes" and other TV series most recently. Produced By Selena Gomez, Stacey Abrams, Aleen Keshishian, Kent Kubena, Terry Leonard, Zack Morgenroth, & Angus Wall. HBO will debut the doc film Louder: The Soundtrack of Change streaming on Max starting October 17th, 2024 coming soon this fall. Who wants to watch this music doc?
